Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Whoo! Wow, it is raining cats and dogs out there. Holy moley.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Phyllis says the same twelve clichés every time it rains. So, I promised everyone that if she says them all by noon today, I will send out for hot chocolates.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: So how was the drive in?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, nobody knows how to drive in the rain.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You don't say?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah. You know the roads are actually the slickest in the first half hour?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, the plants are gonna love this.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I actually sleep better when it's raining.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Tell me about it.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Time's almost up. How many are left?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Just one. "This weather makes me want to stay at home, curled up with a good book."

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Phyllis. This rain... does it make you wanna be doing something?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What do you mean?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You know, like aren't some things just so nice and cozy in the rain?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, come on.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Lots of things are cozy in the rain.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And that's noon. Exactly. [others groan]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I mean, normally the rain would make me want to stay home, curled up with a good book. But everybody's being so nice to me today. I'm really happy being here.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [singing] My girlfriend's back and there's gonna be trouble-

Quote.Speaker: Andy & Erin
Quote.Text: Hey la, hey la...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: ...my girlfriend's back!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [simultaneously] ...his girlfriend's back! [others cheer and applaud]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Anyway, I know it's the end of the day. We just wanted to stop by and say hi.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Welcome home.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, Kev.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Nice sweater.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [wearing a Cornell sweater] Thank you. Nellie was nice enough to give it to me. She's sweet. I just wish there was pockets.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What happened to old salty?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Nellie let me bobble-ize him. His name is now Captain Mutato.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I've written quite a bit of X-Men fan fiction. Captain Mutato is half man, half mermaid. So he can fight crime as a man and make love as a mermaid. Most of my writing involves the latter.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okey dokey. [knocks on door]

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Yes?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Whoa. Well, you must be the famous Nellie Bertram I've been hearing all about. I am the famous Andy Bernard you've been hearing all about.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh yes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I just want to thank you for jumping in and minding the store during my temporary absence.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: You are most welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Anyway, now that I'm back, I would love to have my office back, whenever you get a chance.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Obviously, we'll figure out the, uh, logistics of moving all this stuff out of here. But, you know, the sooner the better.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Get back to normalcy.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Hmm, no.

Quote.Speaker: Ravi
Quote.Text: ...and then just lay him in his crib, and then bicycle his legs. And then after Jim quiets down, you do the same thing with your baby. [Pam, Jim and Kelly laugh] But if he keeps having problems, just give me a call.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh my gosh, thank you so much. But seriously, we don't want to bother you any more than we already have.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's it.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: It's no bother, you guys are our friends.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ravi, our amazing pediatrician, was asking us if we knew any girls and I said I know the perfect girl.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yep. Because Kelly is Indian and... oh, that's it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Race had nothing to do with it. I just knew they'd be good together.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [talks over flashbacks] Kelly has been a handful in the past.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [cries, slams fist on desk] Why?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Ryan and Kelly make out in the nook] But she's had a bad influence. She's like an addict. [Ryan and Kelly argue] And I just had to get her clean.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [Ryan and Kelly make out on Oscar's desk] Get lower.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Um, also, little tip, never shake the baby.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sorry, just to be clear, you're saying do NOT shake the baby.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Don't shake the baby. Um, a lot of times, parents get frustrated 'cause the baby's crying and they shake the baby. And you got to, um, you can't do that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Don't shake our baby?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay. I'd never heard that before. So, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Oh, my God.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, I'm glad you said something.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Me too.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Kelly and I broke up and she can do whatever she wants. And her new boyfriend seems awesome, if you're into Indian people. I'm not.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey, um, what's the deal with this guy? He's really into Kelly, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, they're really great together.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Maybe we weren't right together, but... it's weird. I'd rather she be alone than with somebody. Is that love?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's about it, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Nellie! You've been terrific in your interim capacity. But, Andrew is the rightful manager so if you would just give him his office-

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I'm sorry?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This is what I was trying to tell you.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I'm not accustomed to people saying no to me. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Well, Bobby, get accustomed to it because then it feels so good when they finally say yes.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: You're both adults. I'm sure you can figure this out between yourselves.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I never allow sexual desire to influence a business decision. So I find it best to excuse myself temporarily until I've had a chance to make love and then go back and analyze the situation rationally. Buffett operates the same way.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I'm gonna count down from five and if you are not out of my office, I'm going to dock your pay one hundred dollars.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [chuckling] Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Five... four...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You can't dock my pay-

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Angela! Dock Andy's pay one hundred dollars.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: On it!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Great. Five, four, three, two, one. Angela, please dock Nellie's pay a hundred dollars. Angela?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Do you want to go again?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Angela?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Let's go again. Five... four...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ooh, she's counting again.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Three... two... one...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, oh!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Angela, two hundred dollars!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You got it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Seriously, Angela?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I got a little bit of an anger problem. Got me in some trouble a couple years ago.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: When I see him start to get mad, I just put my hand on his arm like this.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I know what, let's go... ten thousand dollars! [Andy laughs] Five... four...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You're just saying numbers. It's meaningless.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Three...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's literally like-

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Two... [Andy runs out of the room] one.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: There you go. [helps Andy in the car] Hey. we're gonna have a nice, hot date.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hey. So last night was so not a big deal.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah, I was just tired.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: We both were. Plus, I was definitely not my normal sexy self.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Whoa. No. Are you kidding? You were so sexy. Just the thought of you last night, like, crazy turns me on. It just didn't last night.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Really. It's not a big deal.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah. I know it's not... a big deal.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I found this the other day while I was journaling and they reminded me of you.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh, those are from our weekend at the time share.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah, the fractional ownership property. [sigh] Oh, we took this one right before we got in that huge fight.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: God I don't even remember what that fight was about.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You were being really bratty about where we would go out to dinner. But all I remember is how pretty you looked, taking those pictures of me. Anyway, if you want to order prints of your own, I can send you the link.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm in love with Kelly Kapoor. And I don't know how I'm gonna feel tomorrow or the next day or the day after that, but I do know that right here, right now, all I can think about is spending the rest of my life with her. Again, that could change.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: When you lost the manager job-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Did it affect you outside of the office?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I don't know what the technical term is... Penial softiosis?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Erin, I am so glad that you trusted me. You came to the exact right person for this. No, I have never once experienced anything remotely like that. Never.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Washington Monument.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Eiffel Tower.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Okay, okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I saw you were getting along with Ryan again.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: He's so sweet. He pointed to my latte and he said, "Kelly, that will be the color of our children."

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, he's so great. Remember how it felt when he cheated on you though?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Which time?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I am not going to let Kelly throw her life away on Ryan. And it has nothing to do with access to my pediatrician. Why you would even ask or were going to ask, because I- I felt like that question was coming.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: One of Toby's eyes is getting smaller. So there's that. Gabe bragged about having an extra ticket to the air show this weekend and Meredith said she was interested and then Gabe said immediately that his friend might be taking the ticket. So I'll keep you posted on that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Every day I brief Nellie on what's going on in the office. Most of it's irrelevant. But a good informer doesn't judge what's worth passing on.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, and Andy lost his masculinity, so congratulations on that.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: What do you mean?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Erin made it clear to me that he was unable to perform sexually last night. By contrast, I went to sleep with an erection so large it was like I was wearing no blanket at all. Wow, I knew you'd win, but you just demolished him! I'm a little bit jealous, actually. Reduced him to a mere ant.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I just wanted to take the man's job, not his manhood.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Okay, I would like to invite everyone into the conference room.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You can't call a meeting. [laughs] But I would like to have a meeting in the conference room right now! So let's get in the conference room. Thank you. Good. Thank you for coming to my meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Okay, if you would like to take a seat we can get started.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh! Can't do it 'cause I gotta run a meeting. So.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Wanted to talk to all of you guys about [reads whiteboard] importance... and know that each and every one of you is vitally important.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Andrew, not everyone here is important. And the word is "impotence."

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Which is important in its own way. So if you'd just like to take a seat, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: "Take a man's job, but leave him his balls." Margaret Thatcher said that... probably. Don't know. Don't read. Didn't see the movie.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: This meeting is not about any one person in particular. It is a human problem.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's not just a human problem. Flounders frequently experience impotence, especially when converting from male to female and then back again to male.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Nellie, does the person affected by this want us to help her in any way in particular?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, oh, it's not me. No, no. I've never had any problem in that arena. And I have been with several older men.

Quote.Speaker: Robert & Creed
Quote.Text: [in unison] How old?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Jinx. Buy me some Coke.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Dwight told me about it earlier.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: You promised!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Dwight couldn't get it up for Nellie?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no, no, It's not me. I'm gonna prove it right here and now. [thrusts his pelvis]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What is this?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Stop that! Dwight! Stop that, stop it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Fine, it was me. I couldn't- I had a problem with Erin last night. Happy?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I had a lot on my mind last night. And I didn't perform. Okay? It happens to plenty of guys. It's usually not followed by a giant workplace discussion and an interview.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Every guy in this room has been touched by this affliction. Tuna? T-dog?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Uh... I have other issues. I'm terrible at math. Overweight. You- you're in great shape. A lot better shape than I am, tell you what.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: It seems Andy is the only one with this problem. Fascinating.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Fascinating.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I don't really see what the problem is. Erin doesn't even like sex, remember? You said it feels like getting tackled by a skeleton.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Chumbo, come on, help me out. Any problems with Little Chumbo?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Tip-top shape.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh... Stanley?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: No. Um-um.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Creed, you are a thousand years old.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Haven't heard any complaints. Wouldn't care if I did.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay, so I-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Actually Andy, I think maybe we experienced it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What happened?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That a couple of times-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Couple of times.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Jim, maybe you could tell us about one of those times.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah Jim, get it out there.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um... I don't... Uh, yes, that time that it was very late. Uh, we'd had sex so many times already, I was exhausted...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, stop.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I was very drunk.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: If it makes you feel any better, I never had an orgasm until I was forty-two. And then when I did, it lasted 'til I was forty-four.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Forty-three was ju- I got nothing done. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I've read- and I don't know anything about this personally- but they say prostate stimulation can help.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Ugh.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: This is just, uh- This American Life, I think I heard it on.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: No, that's absolutely the case.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I know, right?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know, my rectal electro-ejaculator is rated for bovine use only but I could let you rent it.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Andy, why don't you tell us about the best erection of your life? Or does anyone else have any remarkable erections they'd like to share? [Creed, Kevin and Meredith raise their hands]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Ooh, ooh!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow, what are we talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Toby, doesn't HR have some rules against talking about this kind of stuff?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Erin, HR is a joke. I can't do anything about anything.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: The most important thing to remember is not to stress about this. Stress just makes it worse, and then you stress more. And that's a vicious spiral.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I almost didn't come in today. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Dad, don't think of it as a demotion. Just think of it as a promotion to a lower level. I don't think you have to tell your friends anything. It hasn't been decided yet.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Erin, on phone memos you're writing the date American style. Month, day, year. I prefer it day, month, year. Small, bigger, biggest. Oh, sexual innuendo. Not intentional.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Shut up. Shut up! I am sick of your dumb opinions. And if you don't like the way that I take phone messages, here! [throws phone] Take 'em yourself!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, and another thing! Our sex life is none of your businesses!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: And Andy is the manager, not Nellie!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Stop protecting me! I'm a man- I can protect myself! This is misdirected anger and I'm sorry! I don't mean to lash out at you! There's a lot coming up right now, all at once! [into phone] Dad go to hell, I'm taller than you!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Okay, just calm down.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You are not the manager. I earned that job. I was personally chosen after Robert was chosen and quit.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Andy, why don't you just take a seat?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Why don't you take a seat, you idiot? [throws chair]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: And why don't you take all your stupid memos and your stupid pens and your dumb caramels?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And your stupid face! [grabs Nellie's photo off the wall and smashes it on the ground] And your stupid office! [punches hole in the wall] Ah!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: He does not like that wall.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Maybe we'll get sent to anger management together.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That would actually be cool. I'd love for you to meet some of the guys.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Andy, Erin, you can join us now.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey, I hear you been bad-mouthing me to Kelly.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: All I did was remind her that you used to treat her badly.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Well that's your opinion and it's her opinion, but it's not my opinion. If you have something bad to say to me, Pam, say it to my face.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Fair enough. Um... I don't think you're a very good person. And forgive me, but I feel like I've said this to you before: I don't like you very much.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Well a lot of people would say that I'm a better match for Kelly than Ravi is.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Oh come on, Ryan. Really? Ravi's way better.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: For Kelly?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah. Man, you're insane right now. Ravi's the whole package.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: I've never met Ravi personally, but I'm gonna go ahead and say, just having knowing you a short while, Brian, that I prefer Ravi. And again, I've never even met the guy.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Kelly, I wrote you the most amazing love poem. But I can't even read it. My heart couldn't handle it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, no, no, no.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Oh, come on.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Read it, please. I love amazing poetry.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No. It would cause me too much pain.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Read through the pain. Be strong.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: This poem would crush you!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Ryan, go away! She found herself a beautiful boyfriend!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, man, he's absolutely gorgeous! Please leave her alone.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You see, Kelly? Our love scares them. It screws up their cookie-cutter world.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Ravi makes me incredibly happy. And Ryan puts me through so much drama. So I guess I just have to decide which of those is more important to me.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Andy, we're going to go with Nellie as manager and put you back on the sales team. I promise you, in time, we'll all laugh about this incident. I already think it's kind of funny. [chuckles]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Excuse me?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm saying no.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Well you can't say no.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [sees Ryan on the horse] Oh, boo! Boo! Boo to you! Boo!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You are toxic! You are toxic!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Boo!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, hey. Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Kelly, I have a few things to say to you, so please don't interrupt.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I wasn't going to interrupt.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Well you do a lot, so just don't. Thank you. I know that I haven't always treated you the way that you, for whatever reason, feel you deserve to be treated. But I want to marry you, Kelly Kapoor. Maybe not today, maybe not tomorrow, but someday, and probably.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Barf! Ugh, you suck!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What is your problem? [to horse wrangler] Hey, hey, hey, can we turn this back around quickly, please? This is very important to me.

Quote.Speaker: Wrangler
Quote.Text: Turn around. Turn around. Turn around!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Can we turn this [bleep]-ing thing around? Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Wrangler
Quote.Text: She don't wanna turn around.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Thank you. Kelly, I can't promise you that we'll always stay together. I can't promise you that I'll never cheat on you. Nor should I. Modern marriages aren't built that way. Men aren't built that way. There's a very interesting article I can email to you. But I can tell you this. Even if the odds are fifty-fifty that we'll break up within the week, I wanna roll those dice. I love you, Kelly.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Will you roll those dice with me?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You mean so much to me. But, I love Ravi and I choose him.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No you don't.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I do.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No you don't.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I hope we can still be friends. Can I have a hug?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What? [they hug]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: That was really cool. [they make out]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Ugh. Eww!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, it's good to see Kelly's maturing.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh God!

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Look, Andrew, we can discuss the specifics of the job.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: It's the apology. I really have to insist.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [British accent] No.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Stop saying no.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Andrew, if you say no one more time, you're fired. So... is there anything else you wanna say?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I can't describe it. I just, for the first time in a long time, I actually feel in control. I feel... alive.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Here- [grabs the box Andy's holding]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ah- da, da, da, da. I got it.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: But you hurt your hand.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I... Got... It.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Right now?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You're not the least bit curious to hear a poem straight from Ryan's soul?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Not at all, can we go?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: "Kapoor and ka-desperate, he watches."

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Second line.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: "He is a drifter out to sea."

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: "And when the Indian Ocean calms, one speck of white remains in waters cold and Kelly green."

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's just so dumb. [chokes up] But when he describes himself as a child, lost on the life raft...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, Ryan can never know.
